Can you detect UK land\n you don\'t own without\n landowner permission?
You\'re right - as all land in UK is owned, you need permission first, unless you own the land
When buying a detector should you consider:
As all land in UK is owned, you need permission first, unless you own the land
cost of buying other items e.g. carry case, short spade, pointing device, finds pouch
if you plan to detect on beaches - where only certain detectors can cope with salt water conductivity
how much you can pay for a detector device
you\'ll need additional items (e.g. good walking boots), and consider travel costs too
Some detectors are \'beach\' detectors, others won\'t work on them. More expensive ones typically work well on beaches.
Do your product research. Joining some Facebook UK detector Groups provides good advice, information and dig invites
